intro: Acleisanthes purpusiana var. marshii, commonly known as the marshmallow flower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
